update.description:
So, while trying to make the scoring test work I can into the following problems:

1. The base station is run alongside simulation, and doesn't have access to ros::Time. This is why the CommsClient has a new "isBasestation" variable and listens to simulation's clock topic. I think this should be fine for teams. If they accidentally declare their client as "isBasestation", then they will try to subscribe to the clock, but the topic won't be available.

2. At first, I thought the /pose topic was missing static objects, and the GameLogicPlugin was never getting the pose of the artifacts. This lead me to make the GameLogicPlugin a SystemPlugin. However, I later realized that levels would only publish poses of objects that are loaded. I left the GameLogicPlugin as a system plugin, because I think it's slightly more efficient.

3. I added, and then tried to remove all instances of debug output. If you see something funky with cout/cerr then please go ahead and correct it.

Whomever tests this, can you also make sure that the ROS api for scoring still works? You should be able to exercise this from the commandline. And, score information should appear on both the ingition and ros /subt/score topics.
update.title: More ros removal debugging

content.raw: this is a little confusing since the client is called `X2` but it's setting the `isBaseStation` flag to true. Maybe the arg can be called `useIgnClock`?
content.html: this is a little confusing since the client is called X2 but it's setting the isBaseStation flag to true. Maybe the arg can be called useIgnClock?

content.raw:
noticed that the test also passed if the `isBaseStation` arg is set to true. It just outputs a few of these msgs:

```
Exception in CommsClient::OnMessage. ROS time is probably not initialized.
```

content.raw: protect this variable with a mutex?

I’m using catkin\_make and I’m getting a compile error when doing a clean build of subt. Not sure if you’ve seen this or not

```
/home/ian/code/subt_ws/src/subt/subt_ros/src/SubtRosRelay.cc:23:10: fatal error: subt_msgs/PoseFromArtifact.h: No such file or directory
 #include <subt_msgs/PoseFromArtifact.h>
```

I had to add this to cmake for it to build:

```
diff -r a88c1af11219 subt_ros/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/subt_ros/CMakeLists.txt   Fri Jul 19 08:58:19 2019 -0700
+++ b/subt_ros/CMakeLists.txt   Fri Jul 19 10:58:31 2019 -0700
@@ -32,6 +32,10 @@
 )
 
 add_executable(subt_ros_relay src/SubtRosRelay.cc)
+
+target_include_directories(subt_ros_relay
+  PRIVATE ${CATKIN_DEVEL_PREFIX}/include)
+
 target_link_libraries(subt_ros_relay
   PUBLIC
     ignition-math6::ignition-math6
```
content.html:
I’m using catkin_make and I’m getting a compile error when doing a clean build of subt. Not sure if you’ve seen this or not

/home/ian/code/subt_ws/src/subt/subt_ros/src/SubtRosRelay.cc:23:10: fatal error: subt_msgs/PoseFromArtifact.h: No such file or directory
 #include <subt_msgs/PoseFromArtifact.h>

I had to add this to cmake for it to build:

diff -r a88c1af11219 subt_ros/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/subt_ros/CMakeLists.txt   Fri Jul 19 08:58:19 2019 -0700
+++ b/subt_ros/CMakeLists.txt   Fri Jul 19 10:58:31 2019 -0700
@@ -32,6 +32,10 @@
 )

 add_executable(subt_ros_relay src/SubtRosRelay.cc)
+
+target_include_directories(subt_ros_relay
+  PRIVATE ${CATKIN_DEVEL_PREFIX}/include)
+
 target_link_libraries(subt_ros_relay
   PUBLIC
     ignition-math6::ignition-math6

update.description:
So, while trying to make the scoring test work I can into the following problems:

1. The base station is run alongside simulation, and doesn't have access to ros::Time. This is why the CommsClient has a new "isBasestation" variable and listens to simulation's clock topic. I think this should be fine for teams. If they accidentally declare their client as "isBasestation", then they will try to subscribe to the clock, but the topic won't be available.

2. At first, I thought the /pose topic was missing static objects, and the GameLogicPlugin was never getting the pose of the artifacts. This lead me to make the GameLogicPlugin a SystemPlugin. However, I later realized that levels would only publish poses of objects that are loaded. I left the GameLogicPlugin as a system plugin, because I think it's slightly more efficient.

3. I added, and then tried to remove all instances of debug output. If you see something funky with cout/cerr then please go ahead and correct it.

Whomever tests this, can you also make sure that the ROS api for scoring still works? You should be able to exercise this from the commandline. And, score information should appear on both the ingition and ros /subt/score topics.
update.title: More ros removal debugging

2. At first, I thought the /pose topic was missing static objects, and the GameLogicPlugin was never getting the pose of the artifacts. This lead me to make the GameLogicPlugin a SystemPlugin.
